======== Testing basic functions and constants ==================================
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
  lcalc_cos(Pi) agrees with -1 to: 13 digits.
  lcalc_cos(2)^2 +lcalc_sin(2)^2 agrees with 1 to: 13 digits.
  GAMMA(2) agrees with 1 to: 14 digits.
    --------------- timing tests basic functions
      plain cos: time to do 'for(int j=1;j<=1000000;j++)tmp+=cos(j*x);': 0.011172 seconds
      Accuracy: 10 digits.
      REMARK: above we expect to lose an extra 6 digits just for magnifying error in x by j=10^6
      let x=twoPi/1000000       lcalc_cos: time to do 'for(int j=1;j<=1000000;j++) tmp+=lcalc_cos(j*x);': 0.014044 seconds
      Accuracy: 9 digits.
======== Testing Incomplete Gamma function routines==================================
    --------------- comparing continued fraction vs Temme's asymptotics near the transition zone
      cfrac_GAMMA(1+100*I, 10+100*I) agrees with temme to: 13 digits.
      cfrac_GAMMA(1+1000*I, 10+1000*I) agrees with temme to: 12 digits.
      cfrac_GAMMA(1+10000*I, 10+10000*I) agrees with temme to: 11 digits.
      cfrac_GAMMA(1+100000*I, 10+10000*I) agrees with temme to: 10 digits.
======== Testing Dirichlet L-functions ==================================
  L(1,chi_{-4})  agrees with Pi/4 to: 13 digits.
